colorMatrix.!description: Attribute of SVG tag 'feColorMatrix'. Predefined values are in {@link sap.gantt.def.filter.ColorMatrixValue}. Advanced users can provide a customized matrix in string.

operator.!description: Atrribute of SVG tag 'feMorphology'. Possible values are in {@link sap.gantt.def.filter.MorphologyOperator}.

sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationChart.!constructorDescription:
UtilizationChart is an abstract base class which inherits by UtilizationLineChart and UtilizationBarChart. It defines the common properties and functions that reused by both shapes. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: inherit)
    • {@link #getOverConsumptionMargin overConsumptionMargin} : float (default: 25)
    • {@link #getOverConsumptionColor overConsumptionColor} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: red)
    • {@link #getRemainCapacityColor remainCapacityColor} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: lightgray)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

setOverConsumptionMargin.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOverConsumptionMargin overConsumptionMargin}. Defines the margin height of UtilizationChart When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 25.

parameters.fOverConsumptionMargin: type: float, description: New value for property overConsumptionMargin

getOverConsumptionColor.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getOverConsumptionColor overConsumptionColor}. Defines the over comsumption color, or fill pattern. Default value is red.

setRemainCapacityColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRemainCapacityColor remainCapacityColor}. Defines the remain capacity color. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is lightgray.

parameters.sRemainCapacityColor: type: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer, description: New value for property remainCapacityColor

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.config.TimeHorizon with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

fixedColumnCount.!description:
Deprecated! Since undefined We don't recommend use this property
Property propagated from sap.ui.table.Table.

maxNumOfGanttCharts.!description: Define the maximum number of Gantt charts to be displayed on the same screen. When this number is reached, the "Add Gantt Chart" button is grayed out.

modes.!description: Configuration of available modes. List of available modes. To apply modes to toolbar and shapes, further configuration is needed. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Mode[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

svgDefs.!description: SVG reusable element definitions. If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

enableTimeScrollSync.!description: Switch to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

selectionPanelSize.!description: This property control the size of the selection panel. The value will be overwritten by property selectionPanelSize in sap.gantt.config.ContainerLayout if you are using GanttChartContainer In the current library, sap.gantt.GanttChart does not have a selection panel. sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable has a selection panel implemented by sap.ui.table.TreeTable.

enableShapeTimeDisplay.!description: Switch to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line

baseRowHeight.!description: row height of Gantt Chart. If this property is set, then it will change the Table row height on the left

mode.!description:
Current mode of the Gantt chart.

If no value is provided, GanttChart uses a default mode key.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

shapeDataNames.!description: Configuration of shape data names and the attribute in raw data that serves as 'id'. This property value should be an array, either an array of string, each string represents one available shape data name, or an array of object, each object specifies the shape data name and data attribute that will serves as 'id'. This configuration must be provided if SVG graphics are needed. Example: new sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable({ shapeDataNames: ["task", "order"], shapes: [ new sap.gantt.shape.Shape({ key: "calendar", shapeDataName: "task" shapeClassName: "sap.gantt.shape.Rectangle", // ... }) ] // ... }); or in XMLView <GanttChartWithTable shapeDataNames="task,order"> </GanttChartWithTable>

cellCallback.!description:
A customized cell callback function.

This property is used in combination with configuration property hierarchies. If aggregation columns is provided, property hierarchies and cellCallback is ignored. Otherwise property hierarchies must provide column configurations that cellCallback can consume. And if cellCallback is not provided, a default cellCallback adds sap.m.Label to fill cells.

enableVerticalLine.!description: Switch to show and hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

sliderStep.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.44 please set the property 'stepCountOfSlider' in sap.gantt.config.TimeZoomGroup.
Define the amount of units to change the time zoom slider. See {@link sap.m.Slider#setStep}

enableNowLine.!description: Switch to show and hide the present time indicator

hierarchies.!description: Configuration of hierarchies. List of available hierarchies. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Hierarchy[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

timeAxis.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.44 replaced by aggregation 'axisTimeStrategy'. Planning horizon, initial horizon, and zoom level can be configured with this property. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.TimeAxis. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View
Configuration of the time axis.

containerLayouts.!description: Configuration of container layouts. This configuration affects the data source selection ComboBox in the Container Toolbar. When the selection changes, the ganttChartChangeRequested event that is triggered includes the corresponding layout key. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.ContainerLayout[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

nowLineInUTC.!description: Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time.

objectTypes.!description: Configuration of object types. List of available object types. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.ObjectType[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

selectionMode.!description:
Deprecated! Since undefined Please use tableProperties(e.g. setTableproperties({selectionMode: "None"})) to control table selection mode, and shapeSelectionMode(e.g. setShapeSelectionMode("None")) to control shape selection mode.
Selection mode for GanttChart This property controls whether multiToggle or multi-selection mode is enabled for the tree table and for shapes. It may also affect the visual appearance, such as whether check boxes are available for selection. From version 1.40 to upper versions, multi is replaced by multiToggle selection mode in tree table

ghostAlignment.!description: Defines how to adjust the relative position between a draggable shape and the mouse pointer.

adhocLineLayer.!description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

locale.!description: Configuration of locale settings. Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time option are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

hierarchyKey.!description: Current hierarchy key referencing from configuration property hierarchies. If source select group is enabled in the Gantt chart toolbar, the current hierarchy name referenced from hierarchies by this property is shown. For applications that do not require this function, this property can be ignored and a default value is used.

enableAdhocLine.!description: Switch to show and hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

toolbarSchemes.!description: Configuration of toolbar schemes. List of available toolbar schemes. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.ToolbarScheme[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

shapes.!description: Configuration of shape data against shape classes. List of available shapes. The shapes configured in this list are initialized inside sap.gantt.GanttChartBase. Note that for JSON data binding, this configuration supports deep structured data structures. For ODATA binding, only one level is supported. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Shape[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

timeZoomRate.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.44 please use sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategy to change the zoom rate
Zoom level in float. This property allows application developers to control the zoom level. When GanttChart is embedded in sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer, you do not have to manage this property.

chartSchemes.!description: Configuration of chart schemes. List of available chart schemes. If not provided, a default configuration is provided. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.ChartScheme[]. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly. Limitation: It's defined as a property thus can not be used in XML View

stroke.!description: Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. You can provide the stroke attribute with HTML colors and the URL reference to the paint server. Paint server definitions usually come from paint servers rendered by {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer}, {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable} or {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}.

containerLayoutKey.!description: Current container layout key. This is a key configured in configuration property containerLayouts.

timeStamp.!description: Time stamp of the adhoc line

shapeSelectionMode.!description: Selection mode for shape This property controls 4 shape selection modes(MultiWithKeyboard, Multiple, Single, None). You can use setShapeSelectionMode("None") to set shape selection mode.

enableCursorLine.!description: Switch to show and hide the cursor line that follows the cursor.

sap.gantt.shape.Text.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Text class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: text)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getFontSize fontSize} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getTextAnchor textAnchor} : string (default: start)
    • {@link #getFontFamily fontFamily} : string
    • {@link #getWrapWidth wrapWidth} : float (default: -1)
    • {@link #getWrapDy wrapDy} : float (default: 20)
    • {@link #getTruncateWidth truncateWidth} : float (default: -1)
    • {@link #getEllipsisWidth ellipsisWidth} : float (default: 12)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.

getTruncateWidth.!description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, give a truncate width here. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

setTag.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTag tag}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is text.

parameters.sTag: type: string, description: New value for property tag

sap.gantt.shape.Text.!description: Text shape class using SVG tag 'text'. This shape is usually used to represent points in time.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.shape.Text.

getEllipsisWidth.!description:
Gets the value of property ellipsisWidth.

Ellipsis width if truncate happens. Default value 12 indicates 12px length reserved for ellipsis. If the value is -1, no ellipsis appears even truncate happens. If the value is bigger than -1, ellipsis will be 3 dots in length of this value.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

getText.!description:
Gets the value of property text.

Text string.

Creates and initializes a repeatable text pattern defined for later reuse. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float

    • {@link #getDx dx} : string
    • {@link #getDy dy} : string
    • {@link #getText text} : string

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Definitions#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Definitions} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.control.Cell.!description:
Cell acts as an abstract class. You can use this class to define a placeholder for your application to provide the specific implementation. Applications can fill the cell content by using cellCallback which returns instances such as Icon, Text, or Text input.

You can also use this class to define column specific properties that are applied when rendering a list.

sap.gantt.config.ChartScheme.!description:
The ChartScheme control is one of the settings of {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}.

A Gantt chart uses this setting to decide the mode of Gantt chart and the shapes to display in the Gantt chart. A Gantt chart contains one or more Chart schemes. By switching between these schemes, the Gantt chart can display different shapes.

getKey.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getKey key}.

Unique key of the Chart scheme

Decides the row height of {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartBase} For example, if rowSpan is 2, the row height of the Gantt chart equals twice of the row height of the tree table When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

d attribute of the path element. Your application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of d by using properties length, width, and pointHeight. The value of these properties can be retrieved using the corresponding getters (getLength, getWidth, and getPointHeight).

sap.gantt.shape.Rectangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Rectangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: rect)
    • {@link #getIsDuration isDuration} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 15)
    • {@link #getRx rx} : string (default: 0)
    • {@link #getRy ry} : string (default: 0)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.

getY.!description:
Gets the value of property y.

y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter oRowInfo as a base and uses property height as an offset to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Shape class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColor color} : sap.gantt.PaletteColor (default: sapUiLegend6)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: auto)
    • {@link #getStartX startX} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: auto)
    • {@link #getFill fill} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
    • {@link #getFillOpacity fillOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getSelectable selectable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHoverable hoverable} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.!helpDescription:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

getSelectedColor.!description: Returns hex color for selected shapes.

getXEnd.!description: Computes the x coordinate of the shape end.

setOpacity.!description:
Deprecated! Since undefined true
Sets a new value for property {@link #getOpacity opacity}. This property is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

parameters.fOpacity: type: float, description: New value for property opacity

zoomLevel.!description: Zoom level of all gantt chart instances in GanttChartContainer

selectedStrokeWidth.!description: Defines the stroke width when Relationship is selected

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

interactive.!description: Indicates whether the check box is visible or not.

asyncMode.!description: Defines whether the OverflowToolbar works in async mode. Note: When this property is set to true, the OverflowToolbar makes its layout recalculations asynchronously. This way it is not blocking the thread immediately after re-rendering or resizing.

showLegendButton.!description: Flag to show or hide legend button

textAnchor.!description: This property is used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point

supply.!description: The resource supply capacity, it's only used for UtilizationBarChart

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

countInBirdEye.!description: Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account when performing a bird eye zooming. We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered into bird eye range.

yBias.!description: Y offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, it means translate the visual object to the bottom in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

enableVerticalLine.!description: Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

enableNowLine.!description: Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

active.!description: Indicates that the whole toolbar is clickable. The Press event is fired only if Active is set to true. Note: This property should be used when there are no interactive controls inside the toolbar and the toolbar itself is meant to be interactive.

demand.!description: The required/demand capacity, it's only used for used for UtilizationBarChart

displayType.!description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}.

showMiddleLine.!description: Flag to show or hide the middle line in Utilization Line Chart. The value of the overConsumptionMargin will affect the middle line position. By default the middle line is a gray dashed line

fontSize.!description: The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

style.!description: Defines the visual style of the Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

stepCountOfSlider.!description:
Step count of {@link sap.m.Slider} This property only relevant if zoomControlType are:
  • SliderWithButtons
  • SliderOnly

alignCustomContentToRight.!description:
Defines how the toolbar custom content is aligned.
If set to true, the custom content in the toolbar is right-aligned. If set to false, it's left-aligned.
If a {@link sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbarPlaceholder} with a Spacer type is used in the content aggregation, the alignment of the content depends on this spacer.

zoomControlType.!description: Defines the control type to set the zoom rate.

primary.!description: Whether the scheme apply on the shapes on the main row

successor.!description: successor of the Relationship This property specify where the relationship ends, Relationship lookup the shape instance by the property value.

scheme.!description: Scheme key of the shape. The scheme is used by expand/collapse the main row shape. You can define the scheme together with shapeSchemes in sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the value defines here needse matchs the key value defines in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme

shapeClass.!description: Specifies the shape class name of dimension legend row It's a full shape module name

rx.!description: rx defines a radius on the x-axis.

headWidth.!description: The head width of the Chevron

ghostAlignment.!description: The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event <code>shapeDragEnd<code>

ry.!description: ry defines a radius on the y-axis.

fillFactory.!description: Factory function is used to determine the fill property for different shape classes defined in yDimension config. Shape name of the shape class is passed as a parameter to the function. The return value should be a color code.

predecessor.!description: predecessor of the Relationship This property specify where the relationship starts, Relationship lookup the shape instance based on the property value

enabled.!description: Sets the enabled property of all controls defined in the content aggregation. Note: This property does not apply to the toolbar itself, but rather to its items.

enableAdhocLine.!description: Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

showShapeTimeOnDrag.!description: Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line

draggable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is draggable a draggble shape requires the shape is selectable set true as well.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

selectedStroke.!description: Defines the stroke color when Relationship is selected

strokeDasharray.!description: The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

tailWidth.!description: The tail width of the Chevron

d.!description: The d property provides a path definition to be drawn.

resizable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is resizable. Resizing a shape requires the shape is selectable as well.

filter.!description: The filter property defines the filter effects defined by the <filter> element that shall be applied to its element

enableCursorLine.!description: Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

width.!description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

endTime.!description: end time of the shape. This property is mandatory if the shape is a duration shape. The duration is determined by minusing the value of property time

opacity.!description:
The opacity attribute specifies the transparency of an object or of a group of objects, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

The minimum value is 0.0 and maximum value is 1.0

pointHeight.!description: The point size of a cursor. This property influences generated value d.

connectable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is connectable. When this property is set to true, you can connect two different shapes to create a relationship

showDisplayTypeButton.!description: Flag to show or hide display type menu on the toolbar

enableTimeScrollSync.!description: Flag to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

shapeName.!description: Specifies the name of the dimension legend row

selectionPanelSize.!description: The width of selection panel. In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

infoOfSelectItems.!description:
Array of plain objects that have "key" and "text" properties, or array of sap.ui.core.Item used to configure the items in the {@link sap.m.Select} control

This property is only works if the zoomControlType is Select

layoutOrientation.!description: The GanttChartContainer use Splitter to manager the layout, it can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Note: the property only take effect if GanttChartContainer has more than 1 ganttChart instances

overConsumptionMargin.!description: Defines the margin height of UtilizationChart

fontFamily.!description: This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names

showTimeZoomControl.!description: Flag to show or hide zoom buttons

showEllipsis.!description: Flag to show the ellipsis symbol.

activeShape.!description: Defines which shape from the shapes aggregation is visible. If you specify a negative value or a value that is greater than the number of shapes defined, no shape will be rendered.

overConsumptionColor.!description: Defines the over comsumption color, or fill pattern.

showSettingButton.!description: Flag to show or hide setting button

fill.!description:
The fill property enables you to define the fill color for shapes and texts.

For shapes and text the fill property is a presentation attribute that lets define the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns)

_show.!description: Shows or hides the represented control.

nowLineInUTC.!description: Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time.

name.!description: The name of the utilization dimension, e.g. Total Weight

x1.!description: x1 defines the x-axis coordinate of the line starting point

consumptionColor.!description: The color fills in capacity consumption

x2.!description: x2 defines the x-axis coordinate of the line ending point

strokeWidth.!description: The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

fillOpacity.!description: The fillOpacity property is a presentation property defining the opacity of the paint server (color, gradient, pattern, etc) applied to a shape.

adhocLineLayer.!description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

dragOrientation.!description:
Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

shapeSelectionSettings.!description:
A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "#808080",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
}

hoverable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is hoverable. hovering the mouse pointer over the shape fires the shapeMouseEnter event and moving the mouse pointer out of the shape fires the shapeMouseLeave event.

title.!description: Title of Legend. The title is displayed on both the legend page and the legend navigation list. Null if not specified

navigated.!description: The navigated state of a row. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the row. Note: The navigation indicator is only visible if row actions are available.

highlightText.!description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.ui.table.RowSettings#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes.

highlight.!description: The highlight state of the rows. If the highlight is set to {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType sap.ui.core.MessageType.None} (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.ui.table.RowSettings#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

transform.!description: The transform property defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children Right now in gantt library, only translate() method is supported. CSS methods like scale, skew, rotate and matrix doesn't support. And if you provide values for transform, the values will update xBias and yBias if translate the corresponding axis is matched.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

design.!description: Defines the toolbar design. Note: Design settings are theme-dependent. They also determine the default height of the toolbar.

y1.!description: y1 defines the y-axis coordinate of the line starting point

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

y2.!description: y2 defines the y-axis coordinate of the line ending point

value.!description: The value of the actual consumption capacity. It's only relevant for UtilizationLineChart

disableShapeDoubleClickEvent.!description: Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

rowSpan.!description: row span of the shape scheme. If the shape scheme is not a primary scheme, you need to define how many rows (rowSpan) the expanded shape will take when rendering

src.!description: Src of the image. If the image is represented by an icon font, then the src is sap-icon://task for instance

length.!description: The horizontal length of a cursor. This property influences generated value d.

xBias.!description: X offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, means to translate the visual object to the right in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

stroke.!description: The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape;

shapeSelectionMode.!description: Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed. The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

shapeId.!description: ID of the shape. shapeId property represents a unique identifier for a business object. This property shall be bound to a property during initialization, it requires an unique non-empty value.

showBirdEyeButton.!description: Flag to show or hide bird eye button on the toolbar

time.!description: Start time of the shape. This property is mandatory, you must bind this property to a model or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The value will be converted to x coordination when rendering. If not set, the shape is not visible.

truncateWidth.!description: The width to start truncate the text. If the value is omit, the text is truncated base on it's parent width

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

columnConfig.!description: Column configuration object. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.HierarchyColumn. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

cellCallback.!description: Cell callback function that returns the specific control instance which is rendered in a table.

sap.gantt.config.ObjectType.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new object type Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getMainChartSchemeKey mainChartSchemeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_MAIN_CHART_SCHEME_KEY)
    • {@link #getExpandedChartSchemeKeys expandedChartSchemeKeys} : string[] (default: [])
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Triangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIsClosed isClosed} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBase base} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getDistanceOfyAxisHeight distanceOfyAxisHeight} : float (default: 5)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Path#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Path} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle.!helpDescription:
Triangle shape class using SVG tag 'path'. It's usually treated as a transient shape.

The following image shows how the properties are designed:

getBase.!description:
Gets the value of property base.

Base side of a triangle. This property influences property d.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

getDistanceOfyAxisHeight.!description:
Gets the value of property distanceOfyAxisHeight.

distanceOfyAxisHeight of a triangle, which refers to the distance between the left point to the altitude of the triangle. This property influences property d.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

setBase.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBase base}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 10.

parameters.fBase: type: float, description: New value for property base

getD.!description:
Gets the value of property d.

d attribute of path element. Your application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of d by using properties time, base, height, and distanceOfyAxisHeight. The value of these properties can be retrieved from the corresponding getters (getTime, getBase, getHeight, and getDistanceOfyAxisHeight).

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.config.ZoomControlType.!description: Define the type of zoom control in global tool bar

SliderWithButtons.!description: Uses the SliderWithButtons control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderWithButtons control consists of zoom in and zoom out magnifier buttons and a slider.

SliderOnly.!description: Uses the SliderOnly control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderOnly control only consists of a slider.

Select.!description: Uses the Select control to modify the time zoom rate. The Select control consists of a drop down list to select a suitable zoom rate.

ButtonsOnly.!description: Uses the ButtonsOnly control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderOnly control only consists of zoom in and zoom out buttons.

parameters.bShowEllipsis: type: boolean, description: New value for property showEllipsis

setY.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getY y}. y-axis coordinate When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.fY: type: float, description: New value for property y

parameters.oElement: type: sap.gantt.simple.BaseText, description: BaseText to be rendered
parameters.oRm: type: sap.ui.core.RenderManager, description: A shared RenderManager for GanttChart control

parameters.fX: type: float, description: New value for property x

getFontFamily.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFontFamily fontFamily}. This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names Default value is Arial.

setTruncateWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTruncateWidth truncateWidth}. The width to start truncate the text. If the value is omit, the text is truncated base on it's parent width When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.fTruncateWidth: type: float, description: New value for property truncateWidth

getShowEllipsis.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowEllipsis showEllipsis}. Flag to show the ellipsis symbol. Default value is true.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new BaseText class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getFontSize fontSize} : int (default: 13)
    • {@link #getTextAnchor textAnchor} : string (default: start)
    • {@link #getFontFamily fontFamily} : string (default: Arial)
    • {@link #getTruncateWidth truncateWidth} : float
    • {@link #getShowEllipsis showEllipsis} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

getTruncateWidth.!description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, specifies a truncate width. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated automatically. This method will return the minimum between property truncateWidth and it's parent's width caculated by time range.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.!description: BaseText defines a graphics element consisting of text.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.

getText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getText text}.

Text content

setFontSize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFontSize fontSize}. The fontSize property refers to the size of the font When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 13.

parameters.iFontSize: type: int, description: New value for property fontSize

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.simple.BaseText with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend}.

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

setFontFamily.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFontFamily fontFamily}. This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Arial.

parameters.sFontFamily: type: string, description: New value for property fontFamily

getX.!description:
Gets current value of property x.

x coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time from itself or it's parent that has method getTime. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

getY.!description:
Gets current value of property y.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter RowYCenter and property fontSize to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

sap.gantt.shape.Definitions.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new SVG graphic object according to shape data. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: defs)
    • {@link #getChildTagName childTagName} : string
    • {@link #getContent content} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getReferenceId referenceId} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.shape.Definitions.!helpDescription:
Base class for all SVG definitions. It is different from the svgDefs in GanttChartBase. It is a container shape and related to shape data.

SVG uses the 'defs' tag to represent graphic objects that can be reused at a later time. Currently sap.gantt provides defs like TextRepeat. Applications can also extend this base class to support more functionality.

getChildTagName.!description: Gets the value of the childTagName property. The 'defs' element is a container element for referenced elements. The content model for 'defs' is the same as that for the 'g' element; thus, any element that can be a child of a 'g' can also be a child of a 'defs'. The 'childTagName' is the name of any child element of 'defs'.

getY.!description:
Gets the current value of property y.

y coordinate of the image rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using row context info and makes some adjustments to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbar.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new ContainerToolbar class Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowBirdEyeButton showBirdEyeButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDisplayTypeButton showDisplayTypeButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowLegendButton showLegendButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSettingButton showSettingButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTimeZoomControl showTimeZoomControl} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getZoomControlType zoomControlType} : sap.gantt.config.ZoomControlType (default: SliderWithButtons)
    • {@link #getStepCountOfSlider stepCountOfSlider} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getInfoOfSelectItems infoOfSelectItems} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getZoomLevel zoomLevel} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getAlignCustomContentToRight alignCustomContentToRight} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSettingItems settingItems} : sap.gantt.config.SettingItem[]
    • {@link #getLegendContainer legendContainer} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:zoomStopChange zoomStopChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:birdEyeButtonPress birdEyeButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:displayTypeChange displayTypeChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar#constructor sap.m.OverflowToolbar} can be used as well.

Creates and initializes a new Diamond class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

sap.gantt.shape.ext.Diamond.!helpDescription:
Diamond shape class using SVG tag 'path'. It's usually treated as transient shape.

The following SVG image shows how the properties are designed:

getD.!description:
Gets the value of property d.

d attribute of the path element. You application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates value of d by using properties horizontalDiagonal and verticalDiagonal. The value of these properties can be retrieved using the corresponding getters (getHorizontalDiagonal and getVerticalDiagonal).

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend.!description:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure column to indicate object statuses and row to indicate object types. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and “Unplanned”. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

setY.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getY y}. defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sY: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property y

parameters.sX: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property x

getRy.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRy ry}. ry defines a radius on the y-axis. Default value is 0.

getRx.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRx rx}. rx defines a radius on the x-axis. Default value is 0.

getWidth.!description: Gets the value of property width. Width of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using properties time and endTime

setRx.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRx rx}. rx defines a radius on the x-axis. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.sRx: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property rx

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. height defines the vertical length of the rectangle. By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is auto.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property height

setRy.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRy ry}. ry defines a radius on the y-axis. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.sRy: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property ry

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. width defines the horizontal length of the rectangle. Most of time it's calculated by properties time and endTime automatically When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property width

getX.!description:
Gets the value of property x.

x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time as a base.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle.!constructorDescription:

  • Properties

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

getY.!description: Gets the value of property y. y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation based on the row height and uses height value to position the rectangle in the row center.

parameters.oDate: type: Date, description: The date object to which the user wants the visible area to scroll.

If this aggregation is provided, call back property cellCallBack and column configuration in property hierarchies will be ignored.

sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt Chart with a TreeTable control on the left and a svg chart area on the right. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCellCallback cellCallback} : object
    • {@link #getFixedColumnCount fixedColumnCount} : int
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCustomToolbarItems customToolbarItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.ui.table.Column[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartBase#constructor sap.gantt.GanttChartBase} can be used as well.

setCellCallback.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getCellCallback cellCallback}. A customized cell callback function.

This property is used in combination with configuration property hierarchies. If aggregation columns is provided, property hierarchies and cellCallback is ignored. Otherwise property hierarchies must provide column configurations that cellCallback can consume. And if cellCallback is not provided, a default cellCallback adds sap.m.Label to fill cells.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oCellCallback: type: object, description: New value for property cellCallback

removeAllColumns.!description:

parameters.oCustomToolbarItem: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The customToolbarItem to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.bFlat: type: boolean, description: If set to true, the flat mode is enabled

sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} should be used instead.
Embed a sap.ui.table.TreeTable and a sap.gantt.GanttChart side-by-side.

This class defines: The TreeTable part provide a column view of data with sorting/filtering functions available. The svg chart part provide graphic Gantt chart view of data. Both width can be adjusted by a splitter bar, and row scrolling are always synchronized.3

getCustomToolbarItems.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCustomToolbarItems customToolbarItems}. Controls to be place in Gantt chart toolbar.

This aggregation is only used when custom toolbar item group is configured to be shown in Gantt chart toolbar. Different from the build-in buttons which are configured to be shown or hidden, these are free controls created by application, only they are placed in container toolbar by sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.

A common recommendation is, if the source select group is enabled and application wants to pre-configure container layouts, the chance to change custom toolbar items is in event handler to event ganttChartSwitchRequested.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Both.

getDragOrientation.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDragOrientation dragOrientation}. Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.
Default value is Free.

getAdhocLines.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines}.

The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

parameters.oShapeSelectionSettings: type: object, description: New value for property shapeSelectionSettings

attachShapeMouseLeave.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:shapeMouseLeave shapeMouseLeave} event of this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable itself. Fired when the mouse pointer leaves the shape.
attachShapeMouseLeave.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

getEnableCursorLine.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCursorLine enableCursorLine}. Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor Default value is true.

sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt Chart Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShapeSelectionMode shapeSelectionMode} : sap.gantt.SelectionMode (default: MultiWithKeyboard)
    • {@link #getShapeSelectionSettings shapeSelectionSettings} : object
    • {@link #getEnableCursorLine enableCursorLine} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableNowLine enableNowLine} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNowLineInUTC nowLineInUTC} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableVerticalLine enableVerticalLine} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableAdhocLine enableAdhocLine} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAdhocLineLayer adhocLineLayer} : string (default: sap.gantt.AdhocLineLayer.Top)
    • {@link #getDragOrientation dragOrientation} : sap.gantt.DragOrientation (default: Free)
    • {@link #getGhostAlignment ghostAlignment} : string (default: sap.gantt.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None)
    • {@link #getShowShapeTimeOnDrag showShapeTimeOnDrag} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectionPanelSize selectionPanelSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 30%)
    • {@link #getDisplayType displayType} : sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTableDisplayType (default: Both)
    • {@link #getDisableShapeDoubleClickEvent disableShapeDoubleClickEvent} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTable table} : sap.ui.table.Table
    • {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines} : sap.gantt.AdhocLine[]
    • {@link #getSvgDefs svgDefs} : sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs
    • {@link #getShapeSchemes shapeSchemes} : sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme[]
    • {@link #getCalendarDef calendarDef} : sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDefs
    • {@link #getAxisTimeStrategy axisTimeStrategy} : sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategyBase
    • {@link #getLocale locale} : sap.gantt.config.Locale
  • Events
    • {@link #event:shapeSelectionChange shapeSelectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeResize shapeResize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeMouseEnter shapeMouseEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeMouseLeave shapeMouseLeave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapePress shapePress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeDoubleClick shapeDoubleClick} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeContextMenu shapeContextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dragStart dragStart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeDrop shapeDrop} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:shapeConnect shapeConnect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:visibleHorizonUpdate visibleHorizonUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setEnableAdhocLine.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableAdhocLine enableAdhocLine}. Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnableAdhocLine: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableAdhocLine

fireShapeContextMenu.!description: Fires event {@link #event:shapeContextMenu shapeContextMenu} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

getGhostAlignment.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGhostAlignment ghostAlignment}. The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd Default value is sap.gantt.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None.

removeAdhocLine.!description: Removes a adhocLine from the aggregation {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines}.

parameters.vAdhocLine: type: int|string|sap.gantt.AdhocLine, description: The adhocLine to remove or its index or id

getDisplayType.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayType displayType}. Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. Default value is Both.

fireDragStart.!description: Fires event {@link #event:dragStart dragStart} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

insertShapeScheme.!description: Inserts a shapeScheme into the aggregation {@link #getShapeSchemes shapeSchemes}.

parameters.oShapeScheme: type: sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme, description: The shapeScheme to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the shapeScheme should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the shapeScheme is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the shapeScheme is inserted at the last position

fireShapePress.!description: Fires event {@link #event:shapePress shapePress} to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

fireVisibleHorizonUpdate.!description: Fires event {@link #event:visibleHorizonUpdate visibleHorizonUpdate} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

fireShapeMouseLeave.!description: Fires event {@link #event:shapeMouseLeave shapeMouseLeave} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

detachShapeMouseEnter.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:shapeMouseEnter shapeMouseEnter} event of this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

indexOfAdhocLine.!description: Checks for the provided sap.gantt.AdhocLine in the aggregation {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oAdhocLine: type: sap.gantt.AdhocLine, description: The adhocLine whose index is looked for

destroyTable.!description: Destroys the table in the aggregation {@link #getTable table}.

setGhostAlignment.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGhostAlignment ghostAlignment}. The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is sap.gantt.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None.

parameters.sGhostAlignment: type: string, description: New value for property ghostAlignment

doBirdEye.!description: The Gantt Chart performs Bird Eye on all visible rows or on a specific row depending on the setting of iRowIndex.

parameters.iRowIndex: type: int, description: zero-based index indicating which row to perform Bird Eye on. If you do not specify iRowIndex, the Gantt chart performs Bird Eye on all visible rows.

removeAllAdhocLines.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getLocale.!description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getLocale locale}. Configuration of locale settings. Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

collapse.!description: Collapse the selected row indices by the shape scheme key. This function takes effect only after the control is fully rendered, otherwise it's doing nothing.

parameters.sSchemeKey: type: string, description: the key defined in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme
parameters.vRowIndex: type: int|int[], description: A single index or an array of indices of the rows to be collapsed

detachShapePress.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:shapePress shapePress} event of this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

setNowLineInUTC.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNowLineInUTC nowLineInUTC}. Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bNowLineInUTC: type: boolean, description: New value for property nowLineInUTC

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.def.gradient.LinearGradient with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.gantt.def.DefBase.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created
